subject: Sales
title: Shark Tank: Pitching Under Pressure
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Shark Tank: Pitching Under Pressure.

hook.text: Sixty seconds before five billionaires decide your company's fate. Welcome to Shark Tank.

buildup.text: Shark Tank compresses the pitch into minutes. Only the clearest and most compelling stories survive.

discovery.text: Winners share a pattern: relatable problem, proven traction, clear ask, and a memorable founder story.

twist.text: Many rejected products were excellent. Founders lost because they couldn't communicate value clearly.

climax.text: Shark Tank proves how you pitch matters as much as what you pitch. Communication is the real product.

punchline.text: The best product with the worst pitch still loses.

quiz.question: What pattern do winning Shark Tank pitches share?
options: Clear problem, traction, ask, and a founder story
